text: Acleris affinatana is a species of moth of the family Tortricidae. It is found in South Korea, North Korea, China, Japan and Russia (Siberia, Amur). The wingspan is about 18 mm. The larvae feed on Quercus dentata, Quercus serrata, Quercus acutissima and Zelkovia scheideriana.Check List of the Tribe Tortricini (Lepidoptera: Tortricidae) in Northeast china, with Two Newly Recorded Species from China ==References== Category:Moths described in 1883 affinatana Category:Moths of Asia
title: Acleris affinatana
